member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.CheckCRC32
member.summary: Calculates a checksum value for the entry and compares it to the checksum that was stored when the entry was created.
member.returns: True if the checksum values match, false otherwise.
member.remarks: This method is used to check the integrity of the entries in the zip file. If the calculated checksum does not match the stored checksum, then either the zip file is corrupted or the program used to create the zip file is incompatible with C1Zip.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.CheckPassword
member.summary: Checks whether this can be read with the currently set password.
member.returns: True if the entry can be read with the current password, or if the entry is not encrypted.
member.remarks: This method is more efficient than using a try/catch block and trying to open the entry to determine whether the current password is valid for the entry.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.OpenReader
member.summary: Returns a that can be used to read the content of the entry without extracting it to a disk file.
member.returns: A that can be used to read the data in the entry.
member.remarks: The returned is a , which decompresses the data as it is read from the entry.

member.summary: Adds an entry to the current zip file.
member.param: Name of the file to add to the zip file.
The number of path levels to be stored as the entry name.

remarks.para: By default, path names are not stored in the zip file. For example, adding the file "c:\temp\samples\readme.txt" to the zip file will create an entry called "readme.txt".

The parameter allows you to store one or more levels of the path in the entry name. For example, adding the file "c:\temp\samples\readme.txt" to the zip file with =1 will create an entry called "samples\readme.txt".

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Opens an existing zip file.
member.param: The name of an existing zip file, including the path.

remarks.para: This method checks that the zip file exists and is a valid zip file, then reads the zip file directory into the collection. The zip file is then closed, and can be used by other applications. There is no need to close the zip file explicitly.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Open(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Opens an existing zip file stored in a stream.
member.param: that contains a zip file.

remarks.para: This method allows you to open and work with a zip file stored in a stream instead of in an actual file.
Typical usage scenarios for this are zip files stored as application resources or in binary database fields.

example.para: The example below loads information from a zip file stored in an embedded resource. To embed a zip file in an application, follow these steps:
1) Right-click the project node in Visual Studio, select the Add | Add Existing Item... menu option.
2) Select a zip file to add to the project as an embedded resource.
3) Select the newly added file and make sure the Build Action property is set to "Embedded Resource".

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.OpenBatch
member.summary: Opens the zip file for multiple operations.

remarks.para: By default, opens and closes the zip file automatically whenever entries are added or removed.

This can cause delays in systems that have certain types of anti-virus software installed, or in situations where you want to add a large number of relatively small entries. In these cases, use the and methods to keep the zip file open until the entire operation is concluded.
Use a finally clause to ensure that the method is called even if an exception occurs.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.CloseBatch
member.summary: Closes a zip file after it was opened with a call to the method.
member.remarks: See the method for a complete description and a sample.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.FileName
member.summary: Gets the name of the current zip file.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password to use when adding or retrieving entries from the zip file.

remarks.para: If the property is set to a non-empty string, any entries added to the zip file will be encrypted and protected by the password. To extract these entries later, the same password must be used.
The password applies to all entries from the moment it is set. If you set the password to a non-empty string and then add several entries to the zip file, all entries will use the same password.

Although C1Zip supports Unicode characters in passwords, several popular zip utilities do not. To ensure your encrypted zip files can be opened with third-party utilities, use passwords that consist of ASCII characters only.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Comment

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression level to use when adding entries to the zip file.
member.remarks: Higher compression settings create smaller files, but take longer to process. The default setting () provides a good trade-off between compression and speed.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.MemoryThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the largest stream to be compressed in memory.

remarks.para: compresses entries into temporary streams before adding them to the zip file.
Entries with fewer than bytes are compressed using a temporary memory stream.
Entries with more than bytes are compressed using a temporary file. You can control the location of the temporary file using the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.TempFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the temporary file to use when adding entries to the zip file.
member.remarks: creates temporary streams while adding entries to a zip file. These temporary streams can be memory-based or disk-based, depending on the size of the entry and on the setting of the property. If a temporary file is used, you can control its location by setting the property. If you don't select a path for the temporary file, will create one automatically using the method.

member.name: T:C1.C1Zip.ZipEncoding
member.summary:
Encoding used for entry names and comments
NOTE: this is culture-dependent, which is a really bad idea, but most zip packers use the default OEM code page to encode file names, so we have to go along with it...
Note that Encoding.Default seems like a logical choice but doesn't really work for international locales. Instead, we need to create an encoding using the current OEMCodePage. That allows accents and international characters to be used in file names (like the zip built into Windows, allows names such as "Åland.txt", "Äiti.txt", "Würth.txt", etc.).
This has nothing to do with compression, it's just used to encode and decode entry names and comments.

member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the underlying compressed stream, decompressing them into a buffer, then advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Output stream that will contain the compressed data.
Specifies whether the compressed stream should be compatible with zip files.

remarks.para: Streams in zip files are different from regular zlib streams in two aspects:
(1) zip streams do not contain any local header information (the information is stored in the zip file headers instead) and
(2) zip streams use a CRC32 checksum instead of the adler32 checksum used by zlib streams.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateInit
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for decompression.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: The fields and must be initialized before by the caller.

inflateInit does not perform any decompression apart from reading the zlib header if present: data decompression is done by the method. Therefore, the next_in and avail_in may be modified, but next_out and avail_out are unchanged.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateInit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for decompression.
member.param: Size of the LZ77 sliding compression window in bits (the default value is 15 bits).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Decompresses as much data as possible until the input buffer is exhausted or the output buffer is full.
member.param: How to flush data into the output buffer (default value is 2).
member.returns: Z_OK if some progress has been made (more input processed or more output produced), Z_STREAM_END if the end of the compressed data has been reached and all uncompressed output has been produced, Z_NEED_DICT if a preset dictionary is needed at this point, Z_DATA_ERROR if the input data was corrupted (input stream not conforming to the zlib format or incorrect checksum), Z_STREAM_ERROR if the stream structure was inconsistent (for example if next_in or next_out was null), Z_MEM_ERROR if there was not enough memory, Z_BUF_ERROR if no progress is possible or if there was not enough room in the output buffer when Z_FINISH is used.

remarks.para: inflate performs one or both of the following actions:

1. Decompress more input starting at next_in and update next_in and avail_in accordingly. If not all input can be processed (because there is not enough room in the output buffer), next_in is updated and processing will resume at this point for the next call to inflate.

2. Provide more output starting at next_out and update next_out and avail_out accordingly. inflate provides as much output as possible, until there is no more input data or no more space in the output buffer.

Before the call to inflate, the application should ensure that at least one of the actions is possible, by providing more input and/or consuming more output, and updating the next_* and avail_* values accordingly.
If inflate returns Zero and avail_out == 0, it must be called again after making room in the output buffer because there might be more output pending.
The application can consume the uncompressed output when it wants, for example when the output buffer is full (avail_out == 0), or after each call of inflate.
This method may introduce some output latency (reading input without producing any output) except when forced to flush.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateEnd
member.summary: Frees all dynamically allocated data structures for this stream, discards any unprocessed input, and does not flush any pending output.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSync
member.summary: Skips invalid compressed data until a full flush point is found, or until all available input is skipped. No output is provided.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the decompression dictionary from the given uncompressed byte sequence.
member.param: Data in the dictionary.
Number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: This method must be called immediately after a call of if this call returned Z_NEED_DICT. The dictionary chosen by the compressor can be determined from the Adler32 value returned by this call to inflate.
The compressor and decompressor must use exactly the same dictionary (see the method).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateInit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for compression.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: Compression level 1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression.
Compression level zero gives no compression at all (the input data is simply copied a block at a time).
The default compression level is 6, which provides a compromise between speed and compression.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateInit(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for compression.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
Size of the LZ77 sliding compression window in bits (the default value is 15 bits).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: Compression level 1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression.
Compression level zero gives no compression at all (the input data is simply copied a block at a time).
The default compression level is 6, which provides a compromise between speed and compression.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Compresses as much data as possible, and stops when the input buffer becomes empty or the output buffer becomes full.
member.param: Non-zero to force some data to be flushed into the output buffer.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: deflate performs one or both of the following actions:

1. Compress more input starting at next_in and update next_in and avail_in accordingly. If not all input can be processed (because there is not enough room in the output buffer), next_in and avail_in are updated and processing will resume at this point for the next call to deflate.

2. Provide more output starting at next_out and update next_out and avail_out accordingly. This action is forced if the parameter is non zero. Forcing flush frequently degrades the compression ratio, so this parameter should be set only when necessary (in interactive applications). Some output may be provided even if flush is not set
This method may introduce some output latency (reading input without producing any output) except when forced to flush.
If deflate returns with avail_out == 0, this method must be called again with the same value of the parameter and more output space until the flush is complete (deflate returns with avail_out != 0).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateEnd
member.summary: Frees all dynamically allocated data structures for this stream, discards any unprocessed input, and does not flush any pending output.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateParams(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Dynamically updates the compression level and compression strategy.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
Compression strategy (0-2).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateSetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the compression dictionary from the given byte sequence without producing any compressed output.
member.param: Data in the dictionary.
Number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: This method must be called immediately after , before any call to .
The compressor and decompressor must use exactly the same dictionary (see ).

member.name: T:C1.Util.Win.AmbientPropertyMonitor
member.summary: A helper class for implementing an ambient property on a control.
member.remarks:
Usage: An instance of AmbientPropertyMonitor must be created by the host control with the reference to that host as the parameter. The AmbientPropertyMonitor subscribes to the following events:
ParentChanged on the host and the whole parents' chain;
(ambient property name)Changed or INotifyPropertyChanged on the host and all parents in the chain. NOTE: For the AmbientPropertyMonitor to work correctly, all controls that have the target property declared must also provide either a property changed event, or implement INotifyPropertyChanged and fire it at appropriate moments.
The AmbientPropertyMonitor monitors changes of the ambient property value on the host and all parents, and if a change occurs applies the value of the ambient property on the closest parent to that property on the host control, unless it has been changed independently of the AmbientPropertyMonitor (AmbientPropertyMonitor assumes that when it is created, the ambient property on the host has default, unchanged value).
It is recommended that all controls declaring the target property also provide the Reset(property) and ShouldSerialize(property) methods, calling the and methods as needed.

member.name: F:C1.Util.Win.AmbientPropertyMonitor._pName
member.summary: The target property name.

member.name: F:C1.Util.Win.AmbientPropertyMonitor._parentChain
member.summary: At all times, should contain the up-to-date parent chain, starting with the host itself. Needed to keep track of parent changes, and changes of ambient property on the parents.

member.name: F:C1.Util.Win.AmbientPropertyMonitor._internalChange
member.summary: Prevents raising the _propertySetByUser while we adjust the property ourselves.

member.name: F:C1.Util.Win.AmbientPropertyMonitor._propertySetByUser
member.summary: If true, we consider the property to have a value explicitly set ty the user, so we do not update it anymore until reset.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Win.AmbientPropertyMonitor.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AmbientPropertyMonitor class.
member.param: Control on which the ambient property will be monitored.
The name of the monitored property. The type of the property MUST be an enumeration.
member.remarks: An instance of this class must be created in the constructor of the host control. It is assumed that the value of the ambient property that will be monitored by the AmbientPropertyMonitor has not been set yet (i.e. has the default value) at the time the AmbientPropertyMonitor is constructed.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Win.AmbientPropertyMonitor.ResetValue
member.summary: Notifies the AmbientPropertyMonitor that the value of the monitored property has been reset. If the host control is currently parented to a container which itself defines the monitored property, the value from that parent is assigned to the property on the host.

member.name: P:C1.Util.Win.AmbientPropertyMonitor.IsValueAmbient
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the monitored property currently has the ambient value, i.e. the value has been set (by the AmbientPropertyMonitor) based on the value of a parent of the host.

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.C1LinkTargetFile.FileName
member.summary: Specifies the file or object on which to execute the specified verb.
member.remarks: To specify a Shell namespace object, pass the fully qualified parse name. Note that not all verbs are supported on all objects. For example, not all document types support the "print" verb.

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.C1LinkTargetFile.Command
member.summary: String, referred to in this case as a verb, that specifies the action to be performed.

remarks.para: The set of available verbs depends on the particular file or folder. Generally, the actions available from an object's shortcut menu are available verbs.
For more information about verbs and their availability, see Object Verbs. See Extending Shortcut Menus for further discussion of shortcut menus.
The following verbs are commonly used.

list.item: edit Launches an editor and opens the document for editing. If FileName is not a document file, the function will fail.

item.description: Explores the folder specified by FileName.
Initiates a search starting from the specified directory.
Opens the file specified by the FileName parameter. The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder.
Prints the document file specified by FileName. If FileName is not a document file, the function will fail.

For systems prior to Microsoft? Windows? 2000, the default verb is used if it is valid and available in the registry. If not, the "open" verb is used. For Windows 2000 and later systems, the default verb is used if available. If not, the "open" verb is used. If neither verb is available, the system uses the first verb listed in the registry.

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.C1LinkTargetFile.Parameters
member.summary: If the FileName parameter specifies an executable file, Parameters is a string that specifies the parameters to be passed to the application. The format of this string is determined by the verb that is to be invoked. If FileName specifies a document file, Parameters should be an empty string.

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.C1PrintDocument.AllowNonReflowableDocs
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether methods can be called on the document that would result in the document becoming non-reflowable. If false (the default), invoking such methods causes an exception to be thrown. (If the document is non-reflowable, the document will not automatically reflow in the preview when the end user changes page settings.)

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.C1PrintDocument.ClipPage
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether to clip the content to page margins. The default value is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.C1PrintDocument.DisableUserReflow
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the end user should be allowed to reflow the document with different page settings. This value is only a hint to the document viewer, it is the viewer's responsibility to respect that hint.

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.C1PrintDocument.UseGdiPlusTextRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether all text in the current document should be rendered using the GDI+ text API.

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.C1PrintDocument.DoEvents
member.summary: Specifies whether should handle Windows messages while generating the document.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true allows users to resize forms, click buttons, etc. while documents are being generated. This makes applications more responsive, and is necessary if you want to provide a "Cancel" button to stop the document generation (otherwise the user wouldn't be able to click the button until the generation was complete).
Setting this property to false will cause documents to generate slightly faster.

example.para: The code below implements "Generate" and "Cancel" buttons attached to a .

The "Generate" button checks whether the document is busy before starting to generate it. This is necessary because the user could click the "Generate" button several times in a row, before the document got a chance to finish generating. (Calling the method while the component is busy throws an exception.)
The "Cancel" button checks whether the document is currently generating, and sets the property to true if it is.

member.summary: Defines the stacking rules: block flow or inline flow, LeftToRight or TopToBottom.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.StackingRulesEnum.BlockTopToBottom
member.summary: Objects are placed one beneath the other within the container. When the bottom edge of the current page is reached, a new page is added. This is the default.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.StackingRulesEnum.BlockLeftToRight
member.summary: Objects are placed one next to another, from left to right. When the right edge of the current page is reached, a new horizontal page is added (a horizontal page logically extends the preceding page to the right; C1PreviewPane respects this location by default, showing such pages in a row).

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.StackingRulesEnum.InlineLeftToRight
member.summary: Objects are placed inline, one next to another, from left to right. When the right edge of the current page is reached, the sequence wraps to the next line. A new page is added when the bottom of the current page is reached.

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.RenderArea.HeaderVert
member.summary: Gets or sets a render object that will be repeated on all pages (or columns) if the current render area is split vertically when it is too high to fit on a single page.
member.remarks: The specified render object should not be a child of another render object. It can be a child of the current render area; if it is not, it will be added to the current render area's collection.

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.RenderArea.HeaderHorz
member.summary: Gets or sets a render object that will be repeated on all "horizontal" pages if the current render area is split horizontally when it is too wide to fit on a single page.
member.remarks: The specified render object should not be a child of another render object. It can be a child of the current render area; if it is not, it will be added to the current render area's collection.

member.summary: Graphics object to draw on.

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.RenderGraphics.ReferenceGraphics
member.summary: Gets the reference graphics used to create an underlying metafiles. This property is shortcut to the Document.CreationGraphics property and can return null if this RenderGraphics object is not connected to the document.

member.name: T:C1.C1PreviewClient.RenderImage
member.summary: Represents an image.

member.summary: Defines an image to render.

member.name: P:C1.C1PreviewClient.RenderImage.ImageName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of image in document's dictionary.

member.name: T:C1.C1PreviewClient.SplitBehaviorEnum
member.summary: Defines the splitting behavior of a render object.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.SplitBehaviorEnum.Never
member.summary: The object should not be split between pages (i.e. should always be kept together on a single page).

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitIfNeeded
member.summary: The object can be split if it does not fit onto the current page.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitIfLarge
member.summary: The object can be split only if it is too large to fit on an empty page. In that case, the object is split immediately. Otherwise, a new page is started and the object is placed on it without splitting.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitNewPage
member.summary: If the object does not fit on the current page (column), a new page (column) is started; if the object does not fit on that page (column), it is split as needed after that.

member.name: T:C1.C1PreviewClient.BreakEnum
member.summary: Defines the various breaks which can be forced before or after render object.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.BreakEnum.None
member.summary: No break.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.BreakEnum.Page
member.summary: New page should be started.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.BreakEnum.Column
member.summary: New column should be started.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.BreakEnum.Line
member.summary: New line on inline flow should be started.

member.name: T:C1.C1PreviewClient.VisibilityEnum
member.summary: Specifies the visibility of an object.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.VisibilityEnum.Visible
member.summary: Object is visible.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.VisibilityEnum.Hidden
member.summary: Object is not visible, but takes up space and affects the layout of other objects as if it were visible.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.VisibilityEnum.Collapse
member.summary: Object is not visible, its size is zero and it does not affect the layout of other objects.

member.name: T:C1.C1PreviewClient.IRenderObjectContainer
member.summary: This interface must be implemented by object which works as owner for the RenderObject objects.

member.summary: Size (height for rows, width for columns) should be explicitly specified (if omitted, is determined by the available space and row/column count).

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.TableSizingModeEnum.Auto
member.summary: Size (height for rows, width for columns) is calculated automatically based on the content.

member.name: T:C1.C1PreviewClient.TableHeaderEnum
member.summary: Defines how the table header is repeated.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.TableHeaderEnum.None
member.summary: The header is printed once at the top of the table.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.TableHeaderEnum.Page
member.summary: The header is repeated at the top of each page. If there are multiple columns per page, the header is repeated only at the top of the first column on the page.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.TableHeaderEnum.Column
member.summary: The header is repeated only if there are multiple columns per page, at the top of each column except the first on the page. If there is only one column, the header is not printed at all.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.TableHeaderEnum.All
member.summary: The header is repeated at the top of all pages. If there are multiple columns per page, the header is repeated at the top of each column.

member.name: T:C1.C1PreviewClient.TableFooterEnum
member.summary: Defines how the table footer is repeated.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.TableFooterEnum.None
member.summary: The footer is printed once at the end of the table.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.TableFooterEnum.Page
member.summary: The footer is repeated at the bottom of each page. If there are multiple columns per page, the footer is repeated only at the bottom of the last column on the page.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.TableFooterEnum.Column
member.summary: The footer is repeated only if there are multiple columns per page, at the bottom of each column except the last on the page. If there is only one column, the footer is not printed at all.

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.TableFooterEnum.All
member.summary: The footer is repeated at the bottom of all pages. If there are multiple columns per page, the footer is repeated at the bottom of each column.

ShouldSerializeXXX method is not defined in obj for member described by this TypeInfoItem object or this method returns true for value specified by propValue parameter. 1. propValue does not equal DefaultValue for member described by this TypeInfoItem object.

member.returns: Returns true if property of obj must be serialized.

member.param: The string to convert. If it is null or empty, units are set to UnitTypeEnum.Default.
On exit, contains the UnitTypeEnum value.
member.returns: Returns true if no error occurs, false otherwise.

member.summary:
Converts a UnitTypeEnum value to the string representation.
DefaultEmpty string
Document"doc"
Inch"in"
Millimeter"mm"
Pica"pc"
Pixel"pix"
Point"pt"
Twip"tw"
InHs"inhs"
member.param: Value to convert.

member.name: M:C1.C1PreviewClient.LengthBase.StringToDimension(System.String,C1.C1PreviewClient.DimensionEnum@)
member.summary: Converts a string to DimensionEnum. String can have value from: ("left", "top", "right", "bottom", "width", "height", "relleft", "reltop", "relright", "relbottom"). Method is case insensitive.

Contains a dimension on exit.
member.returns: Returns true if no error occurs.

member.name: M:C1.C1PreviewClient.Utils.IndexInArray(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of string in array of strings. Search is case sensitive.
member.param: Array of strings.
String to search.
member.returns: Index of string in array of -1.

member.name: M:C1.C1PreviewClient.Utils.TryParseInt(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its 32-bit signed integer equivalent. A return value indicates whether the operation succeeded. This functions uses FloatFormatInfo as format provider.
member.param: A string containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the 32-bit signed integer value equivalent to the number contained in s, if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not of the correct format, or represents a number less than MinValue or greater than MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:C1.C1PreviewClient.Utils.TryParseDouble(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its double-precision floating-point number equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. This functions uses FloatFormatInfo as format provider.
member.param: A string containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains a double-precision floating-point number equivalent to the numeric value or symbol contained in s, if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not in a format compliant with style, represents a number less than MinValue or greater than MaxValue, or if style is not a valid combination of NumberStyles enumerated constants. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

members.member:
Summary description for WinUser.
CAUTION: Use this attribute with extreme care. Incorrect use can create security weaknesses. This attribute can be applied to methods that want to call into native code without incurring the performance loss of a run-time security check in doing so. The assertion and subsequent demands performed when calling unmanaged code is omitted at run time, resulting in substantial performance savings. Only code that has been granted the UnmanagedCode permission can do this (see SecurityPermissionFlag). Using this attribute in a class or module applies to all contained methods.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.AllowSort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the ability of the grid to automatically sort data when a column header is clicked.

remarks.para: If True, and if the property is set to GroupBy, the grid will automatically filter column data upon grouping action.
If False, the grid will fire the event.
If the property is set to Group By and the user attempts to drag a column header into the grouping area, the grid will automatically sort the column data.
If False, the event allows the application to sort the data.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.AllowFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the ability of the grid to automatically filter data.

remarks.para: If True, and if the Filter Bar is active, the grid will automatically filter data.
If False, the grid will fire the event.
If the property is true and the user attempts to filter column data, the grid will automatically filter the column data according to the value in the Filter Bar.
If False, the event allows the application to filter the data.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.Caption
member.summary: Gets or sets the grid's caption.

remarks.para: For a control, this property determines the text displayed in the caption bar at the top of the grid.
Setting the Caption property to an empty string for a control hides its caption bar.
For a object, this property determines the text displayed in the object's heading area.

Setting the Caption property to an empty string for a object clears the text in the column's heading area but does not hide the heading. Column captions are only displayed if the grid's property is set to True.
Setting the Caption property to an empty string for a object hides the heading area, even if other splits have non-empty captions.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the grid's caption.
member.remarks: This property requires that the property of the grid has a value.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.RowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of grid rows.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.DataMember
member.summary: Gets or sets the specific data member in a multimember data source that the grid binds to.

remarks.para: This property returns or sets the name of the data member used to populate the grid. Typically, a data member represents a database table or query.
A bound can expose multiple sets of data that consumers can bind to. Each set of data is called a data member, and is identified by a unique string.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the source containing a list of values used to populate the items within the control.
member.remarks: The DataSource property specifies the list of values used to bind a or control.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.DoubleBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control should use an off-screen buffer when painting to redue flicker.

remarks.para: Setting this value to False may cause the grid to flicker when the control is painting.
You may want to set DoubleBuffer to False to increase performance when deploying applications that run on terminal servers.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.FlatStyle

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.RowCount

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.UseColumnStyles

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BaseGrid.Frame.VisualStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the overall appearance of the control.

remarks.para: This property allows you to quickly customize the appearance of the grid so it matches the appearance of your application.
The settings available include System, various Microsoft Office color schemes, and Custom, which relies on the controls standard styles and appearance properties.

remarks.para: The property allows an input mask to be specified for automatic input formatting and validation. The mask syntax is similar to the one used by Microsoft Access. Setting the input mask for a column will prevent the user from entering any information in the cell that is not in the format of the string.
The must be a string composed of the following symbols:

item.description: Next character is taken as a literal.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.C1TrueDBGrid.CellContaining(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the cell position for a set of coordinates.
member.param: The x-coordinate.
The y-coordinate.
The row under the coordinate pair.
The column index under the coordinate pair.
member.returns: A value indicating whether a data cell is beneath the specified coordinate pair.

remarks.para: The CellContaining method combines the and methods into one call. If the coordinate pair specified by x and y points to a data cell, this method returns True, and the rowindex and colindex arguments receive zero-based indexes that identify the cell.
This method is useful when working with mouse and drag events when trying to determine where the user clicked or dropped another control in terms of a grid cell.
If the specified coordinate is outside of the grid's data area, this method returns False. Use the method to determine what kind of grid element, if any, is beneath the specified coordinate.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.C1TrueDBGrid.RefreshRow
member.summary: Invalidates the current row.
member.remarks: The RefreshRow method causes a repaint of the entire row in the grid. Normally, the grid repaints automatically as needed. However, if handlers have been written for the event, use this method to force a row to be repainted and hence cause the appropriate events to fire.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.C1TrueDBGrid.RefreshRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Invalidates the current row.
member.param: The row to refresh.
member.remarks: The RefreshRow method causes a repaint of the entire row in the grid. Normally, the grid repaints automatically as needed. However, if handlers have been written for the event, use this method to force a row to be repainted and hence cause the appropriate events to fire.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.C1TrueDBGrid.RefreshCol
member.summary: Invalidates the current column.
member.remarks: The RefreshCol method causes a repaint of the entire column in the grid. Normally, the grid repaints automatically as needed. However, if handlers have been written for the event, use this method to force a column to be repainted and hence cause the appropriate events to fire.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.C1TrueDBGrid.RefreshCol(System.Int32)
member.summary: Invalidates the specified column.
member.param: The split column index to repaint.
member.remarks: The RefreshCol method causes a repaint of the entire column in the grid. Normally, the grid repaints automatically as needed. However, if handlers have been written for the event, use this method to force a column to be repainted and hence cause the appropriate events to fire.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.C1TrueDBGrid.RefetchRow
member.summary: Retreives data from the datasource for the current row and refreshes the row.

remarks.para: The RefetchRow method repopulates the specified row from a data source. It also repaints the row, firing all events necessary for redisplay.

By default, the grid retrieves data automatically as needed. In some circumstances, the underlying datasource may change without the grid receiving notification that a change has occurred. The RefetchRow method is provided for this purpose.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.C1TrueDBGrid.RefetchRow(System.Int32)

member.param: The row to refetch.

remarks.para: The RefetchRow method repopulates the specified row from a data source. It also repaints the row, firing all events necessary for redisplay.

By default, the grid retrieves data automatically as needed. In some circumstances, the underlying datasource may change without the grid receiving notification that a change has occurred. The RefetchRow method is provided for this purpose.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.C1TrueDBGrid.CellTipsWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the cell tip window.

remarks.para: The CellTipsWidth property returns or sets the width of the cell tip window in pixels.

By default, this property is set to zero, which causes the cell tip window to grow or shrink to accommodate the cell tip text. Override this behavior and give the cell tip window a fixed width by specifying a non-zero value for this property.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.Util.Xml.Serialization.IMemberTypeEncoder
member.summary: This interface is used to allow objects and collection to serialize types of their members in a custom way. If a collection implements this interface, TypeToString is invoked during serialization of collection items, and for all items for which it returns a non-null string, that string is used as the element name of the item. If a class implements this interface, AND a member of that class has attribute TypeNameSerialization.Custom, AND does not have attribute XmlAttribute (i.e. is serialized as an element), TypeToString is invoked on the owner when that member is serialized, and if that returns a non-null string, that string is used as the value of TypeName attribute. When deserializing a collection which implements this interface, StringToType is invoked for each new item in the collection, and if that returns a non-null type, that type is used to create the item. Otherwise, TypeNameSerialization attribute is used. When deserializing a class which implements this interface, StringToType is invoked on that class for members with TypeNameSerialization.Custom attribute set.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.Util.Xml.Serialization.IMemberTypeEncoder.TypeToString(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a string representing the type of the object

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.Util.Xml.Serialization.IMemberTypeEncoder.StringToType(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the type restored from the serialized string

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.SortDirEnum.None
member.summary: Column is not sorted.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.SortDirEnum.Ascending
member.summary: Column is sorted in ascending order.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.SortDirEnum.Descending

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MultiSelectEnum
member.summary: Specifies the UI behavior for selecting rows and columns.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MultiSelectEnum.None
member.summary: Multiple selection is disabled but single selection is permitted. When the user clicks a record selector, the current selection is cleared, and the clicked row is then selected and added to either the SelectedRows or SelectedCols collections. The Ctrl and Shift keys are ignored, and the user can only select one row at a time.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MultiSelectEnum.Simple
member.summary: Multiple selection is enabled using the mouse. When the user clicks a record selector, the selection is cleared and the clicked row is selected and added to either the SelectedRows or Selected Cols collections. However, if the user holds down the Ctrl key while clicking, the clicked row is added to the current selection. The user can also select a range of rows by selecting the first row in the range, then selecting the last row in the range while holding down the Shift key.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MultiSelectEnum.Extended
member.summary: Multiple selection is enabled using the mouse. The user can also select records with the following key combinations: Shift + Up Arrow, Shift + Down Arrow, Shift + PgUp, and Shift + PgDn. NOTE: The user will not be able to select a single cell, instead the entire corresponding row will be selected.

member.summary: Specifies how 3D elements are rendered.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.FlatModeEnum.Standard
member.summary: The grid’s column headers and recordselectors are rendered with an inset three-dimensional look

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.FlatModeEnum.Flat
member.summary: Three-dimensional elements appear flat

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.FlatModeEnum.Popup
member.summary: Three-dimensional elements are flat, but when the user drags the cursor over a column heading or recordselector, they become three-dimensional and appear to pop up.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.FlatModeEnum.System
member.summary: Three-dimensional elements uses XP Themes if available.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.SizeModeEnum.NumberOfColumns

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.AlignHorzEnum.Center
member.summary: Text is aligned centered.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.AlignHorzEnum.Far
member.summary: Text is aligned to the right.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.AlignHorzEnum.Justify

member.summary: ScrollBars are always displayed.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.LineStyleEnum.Double
member.summary: Double line.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.LineStyleEnum.Raised
member.summary: Line with 3D raised appearance.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.DataViewEnum
member.summary: Specifies how the grid displays its data.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.DataViewEnum.Normal
member.summary: The grid will only display flat files and will not support a hierarchical view. If the data source is a hierarchical dataset, the grid will only display data from the master table.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.DataViewEnum.Inverted
member.summary: Rows will be represented horizontally and columns vertically.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.DataViewEnum.Form
member.summary: The data will be displayed in a convenient data entry form.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.DataViewEnum.GroupBy
member.summary: A grouping area is created at the top of the grid; any columns that are placed into this area become part of the GroupedColumn collection. When in group mode, grid columns can be moved into or out of the grouping area with the Add and RemoveAt methods, respectively. Users can also perform this action by selecting and dragging a column into or out of the grouping. Users can customize the display of the grouped row with styles and automatically compute aggregates for columns that are grouped. The expanded/collapsed state of the grouping can also be specified.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.DataViewEnum.MultipleLines
member.summary: The grid will display all the fields in the current grid area with multiple lines.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.DataViewEnum.Hierarchical
member.summary: The grid will display DataSets in a hierarchical format. At run time, users can expand and collapse hierarchical recordset Bands using a treeview-like interface.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.DataViewEnum.MultipleLinesFixed
member.summary: The grid will display all the fields in the current grid area with multiple lines. The number of subrows does not change once set. The number of subrows can be set using the LinesPerRow property.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.AddNewModeEnum
member.summary: Provides a description of the current addnew state with respect to the current cell.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.AddNewModeEnum.NoAddNew
member.summary: The current cell is not on the addnew row.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.AddNewModeEnum.AddNewCurrent
member.summary: The current cell is on the addnew row.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.AddNewModeEnum.AddNewPending
member.summary: There is an Add New operation pending.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.CellTipEnum.NoCellTips
member.summary: No cell tips will be displayed.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.CellTipEnum.Anchored
member.summary: Cell tips will be displayed in the bounding rectable of the cell.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.CellTipEnum.Floating
member.summary: Cell tips will be displayed under the mouse cursor.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.ExposeCellModeEnum
member.summary: Specifies how the grid exposes the rightmost column when it gets focus.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.ExposeCellModeEnum.ScrollOnSelect
member.summary: The grid will scroll to the left to display the rightmost column in its entirety.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.ExposeCellModeEnum.ScrollOnEdit
member.summary: The grid will not move when the rightmost column is clicked initially. However, if the user attempts to edit the cell, then the grid will scroll to the left to display the rightmost column in its entirety.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.ExposeCellModeEnum.ScrollNever
member.summary: The grid will always leave the rightmost column clipped.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.ForeGroundPicturePositionEnum.TextOnly
member.summary: Image is not displayed.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BackgroundPictureDrawModeEnum

member.summary: Specifies how focus is handled when the Tab key is entered.

member.summary: The tab key moves to the next or previous control on the form.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.TabActionEnum.ColumnNavigation
member.summary: The tab key moves the current cell to the next or previous column. However, if this action would cause the current row to change, then the next or previous control on the form receives focus.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.TabActionEnum.GridNavigation
member.summary: The tab key moves the current cell to the next or previous column. The behavior of the tab key at row boundaries is determined by the property. When this setting is used, the tab key never results in movement to another control.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.CellStyleFlag
member.summary:
Describes the disposition of a cell.
This enumeration has a FlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.CellStyleFlag.NormalCell
member.summary: The cell satisfies none of the conditions. For grouped rows, this is the only applicable cell style.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.CellStyleFlag.CurrentCell
member.summary: The cell is the that currently has focus. At any given time, only one cell can have this status. When the MarqueeStyle property is set to Floating Editor, this condition is ignored.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.CellStyleFlag.MarqueeRow
member.summary: The cell is part of a highlighted row marquee. When the MarqueeStyle property indicates that the entire current row is to be highlighted, all visible cells in the current row have this additional condition set.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.CellStyleFlag.UpdatedCell
member.summary: The cell contents have been modified by the user but not yet written to the datasource. This condition is also set when cell contents have been modified in code with the Text or Value properties.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.CellStyleFlag.SelectedRow
member.summary: The cell is part of a row selected by the user or in code. The SelectedRowCollection contains the index for each selected row.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.CellStyleFlag.AllCells
member.summary: All cells.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MarqueeEnum
member.summary: Specifies how the current cell is highlighted.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MarqueeEnum.DottedCellBorder
member.summary: The current cell within the current row will be highlighted by drawing a dotted border around the cell. In Microsoft Windows terminology, this is usually called a focus rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MarqueeEnum.SolidCellBorder
member.summary: The current cell within the current row will be highlighted by drawing a solid box around the current cell. This is more visible than the dotted cell border, especially when 3D divider properties are used for the grid.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MarqueeEnum.HighlightCell
member.summary: The entire current cell will be drawn using the attributes of the HighlightRowStyle property. This provides a very distinctive block-style highlight for the current cell.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MarqueeEnum.HighlightRow
member.summary: The entire row containing the current cell will be drawn using the attributes of the HighlightRowStyle property. In this mode, it is not possible to visually determine which cell is the current cell, only the current row. When the grid or split is not editable, this setting is often preferred, since cell position is then irrelevant.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MarqueeEnum.HighlightRowRaiseCell
member.summary: The entire row will be highlighted as in setting 3, but the current cell within the row will be "raised" so that it appears distinctive. This setting does not appear clearly with all background color and divider settings. The best effect is achieved by using 3D dividers and a light gray background.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MarqueeEnum.NoMarquee
member.summary: The marquee will not be shown. This setting is useful for cases where the current row is irrelevant, or when not wanting to draw the user's attention to the grid until necessary.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MarqueeEnum.FloatingEditor
member.summary: The current cell will be highlighted by a floating text editor window with a blinking caret (as in Microsoft Access).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.MarqueeEnum.DottedRowBorder
member.summary: The entire current row will be highlighted by drawing a dotted border around it. This effect is similar to setting 0.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that editing should be disallowed.
member.remarks: If event procedure sets the Cancel argument to True, the cell will not enter edit mode. Otherwise, the ColEdit event is raised immediately, followed by the Change event for the KeyChar property, if non-zero.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BeforeColEditEventArgs.KeyChar
member.summary: Indicates the character that initiated the editing operation.
member.remarks: The BeforeColEdit event occurs just before the user enters edit mode by typing a character. If a floating editor marquee is not in use, this event also occurs when the user clicks the current cell or double clicks another cell.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.BeforeColUpdateEventHandler
member.summary: Raised after editing is completed in a cell.
member.remarks: The BeforeColUpdate event occurs after editing is completed in a cell, but before data is moved from the cell to the grid's internal copy buffer. The data specified by the OldValue argument moves from the cell to the grid's copy buffer when the user completes editing within a cell, as when tabbing to another column in the same row, pressing the Enter key, or clicking on another cell. Before the data has been moved from the cell into the grid's copy buffer, the BeforeColUpdate event is triggered. This event gives the application an opportunity to check the individual grid cells before they are committed to the grid's copy buffer. If your event procedure sets the Cancel argument to True, the previous value is restored in the cell, the grid retains focus, and the AfterColUpdate event is not triggered. Change the current cell text by setting OldValue to the value wanted to display (other than the previous value). To restore OldValue in the cell and permit the user to move focus off of the cell, set Cancel to False and set the cell to OldValue as follows:

member.summary: This function deals with the general cell drawing. If it has only text, just draw the text. If it has image (background or forground etc.), then we need to draw an area, then the image and text. Because we only have text most of the time, this process will speed things up.

Width of the cell, in %%.
The parent object.
The name of the image to use.
member.returns: The render object representing the cell's content.

member.summary: StyleContext contains a base Style definition and a list of named Styles. It provides the following services: - Style management (create, edit, and remove Styles) - Style inheritance mechanism - Rendering and measuring methods

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1TrueDBGrid.Styles.BaseStyle
member.summary: Style contains a collection of arbitrary attributes, represented by a name/object entry, a reference to a parent Style, and a referrence to the containing StyleContext.
